intro: Dorstenia psilurus var. compacta, commonly known as the compact dwarf spiderwort, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and its ability to produce small, spider-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features fleshy, often hairy leaves that are adapted to arid environments, and its stems are typically short and thick. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in shaded, moist habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is a popular choice for indoor and greenhouse cultivation.
